DOC.brief_title: Intervening Reduce Suicide Risk Veterans With Substance Use Disorders
DOC.detailed_description: The project multi-site randomize control trial CBT intervention versus SPC condition 300 suicidal Veterans see Veterans Health Administration ( VHA ) intensive outpatient substance treatment program ( SUD IOP ) . Participants screen current suicidal ideation condition complete self-report survey questionnaire . Eligible participant complete baseline assessment include self-report survey questionnaire , research staff administer interview , voluntary urine drug screen . Participants randomize either Cognitive Behavior Therapy ( CBT ) Supportive Psycho-education Control ( SPC ) condition . Both condition involve receipt 8 one-on-one session last approximately one hour period approximately 3-4 week addition standard SUD IOP treatment care may receive VAMC . The intervention design augment current treatment , take place current treatment . Participants re-assessed immediately receive study intervention ( 1-month ) 3- , 6- 12- , 18- , 24-month post-intervention follow-up complete series self-report survey , researcher administer interview , voluntary urine drug screen . To ensure adequate monitoring suicidal ideation , additional telephone follow-up assessment occur 2- , 4- , 5-months post-intervention .
